meanings.definition: Having the taste or smell of cinnamon.
meanings.sent1: The cookies were cinnamony and made the whole kitchen smell sweet.
meanings.sent2: I love the cinnamony flavor of the hot apple cider.
meanings.sent3: The cinnamony aroma of the candle reminded me of cozy winter nights.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a cinnamony warmth that enveloped everyone in comfort.
meanings.sent5: The cinnamony scent of the bakery drew customers in from the street.

meanings.sent1: The old book had a cinnamony color on its cover.
meanings.sent2: The fabric had a cinnamony hue that matched the fall leaves.
meanings.sent3: The cinnamony paint on the walls gave the room a cozy feel.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a cinnamony shine that caught the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The cinnamony tones of the music created a warm and inviting atmosphere.
